Package chase.minecraft.architectury.warpmod.server

Class RepeatingServerTasks

java.lang.Object
chase.minecraft.architectury.warpmod.server.RepeatingServerTasks
public class RepeatingServerTasks extends Object
The `RepeatingServerTasks` class is a singleton class in Java that allows for the creation, retrieval, and removal of repeating server tasks.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create(String name, long rate, Runnable action)
      This Java function creates a repeating server task with a given name, rate, and action to be executed.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the task being created.
      rate - The rate parameter is a long value that represents the time interval in milliseconds between each execution of the action Runnable in the RepeatingServerTask. The task will be executed repeatedly at a fixed rate specified by this parameter.
      action - "action" is a Runnable object that represents the task to be executed repeatedly by the RepeatingServerTask. It is a block of code that can be executed by calling the "run()" method of the Runnable object. The "action" parameter is passed to the "create" method to specify the

    • get

      public RepeatingServerTask get(String name)
      This function returns a RepeatingServerTask object based on its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The parameter "name" is a String that represents the name of a RepeatingServerTask object that is stored in a HashMap called "_tasks". The method "get" retrieves the RepeatingServerTask object associated with the given name from the HashMap.
      Returns:
      A `RepeatingServerTask` object associated with the given `name` key from the `_tasks` map.

    • exists

      public boolean exists(String name)
      The function checks if a task with a given name exists in a collection of tasks.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the task that we want to check if it exists in the `_tasks` map. The method returns `true` if the task exists in the map, and `false` otherwise.
      Returns:
      The method `exists` is returning a boolean value. It returns `true` if the `_tasks` map contains a key that matches the `name` parameter, and `false` otherwise.

    • remove

      public void remove(String name)
      This function removes a task with the given name if it exists.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the task to be removed from the list of tasks.
